c:complexType.name: CartesianChartCommonOptions
c:complexType.c:documentation: The common options documentation class for the Cartesian charts.

c:property.name: baseAxis
c:property.c:documentation:
The base axis panel.
When the chart is vertical the base axis is laid out horizontally.
See to know the additional names by which a cartesian axis can be referred to.

c:property.name: orthoAxis
c:property.c:documentation:
The orthogonal axis panel.
When the chart is vertical the orthogonal axis is laid out vertically.
See to know the additional names by which a cartesian axis can be referred to.

c:property.name: showXScale
c:property.c:documentation:
Use , of the x axis, instead.
Indicates whether the x axis panel is shown.

c:property.name: showYScale
c:property.c:documentation:
Use , of the y axis, instead.
Indicates whether the y axis panel is shown.

c:property.name: visualRoles
c:property.c:documentation: The visual roles that are common to (almost) all cartesian chart types.

c:property.name: extensionPoints
c:property.c:documentation: The extension points object contains style definitions for the marks of the chart.

c:complexType.name: CartesianCommonVisualRoles
c:complexType.c:documentation: The visual roles common to (almost) all cartesian chart types.

c:property.name: series
c:property.c:documentation:
The series visual role represents a series of connected data points.
Most cartesian charts represent graphically the connectedness of data points of a given series in some way, by connecting points with a line, by giving them all the same color, or, simply, by the order in which they are drawn, and when overlapped, some stay on top of others.
The series visual role automatically binds to every dimension whose name has the series prefix.
The visual role itself is optional, yet, when unbound, a dimension with a "series" prefix is automatically created for it, and all datums will have the value null in that dimension.
The only cartesian chart type that ignores the series visual role is the Box plot.
See for more information on supported data types.

c:property.name: color
c:property.c:documentation:
The color visual role controls the color of visual elements.
The color visual role automatically binds to every dimension whose name has the color prefix or, if none exists, the dimensions of the "series" role.
The color visual role is discrete.
See for more information on supported data types.

c:complexType.name: CartesianChartCommonExtensionPoints
c:complexType.c:documentation: The extension points common to all cartesian chart types.

c:property.name: plotFrame
c:property.c:documentation:
The extension point of the plot frame of the charts.
The plot frame covers the plot panel but stays aligned with and below the axes' rules.
The root of a small multiples chart does not have a plot frame.

c:property.name: xAxisGrid
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the grid line rules that are drawn one per major tick of the XX axis (an horizontal axis has vertical grid line rules).

c:property.name: yAxisGrid
c:property.c:documentation: The extension point of the grid line rules that are drawn one per major tick of the YY axis (a vertical axis has horizontal grid line rules).

c:complexType.name: CartesianPlotCommonOptions
c:complexType.c:documentation: The common options documentation class of cartesian plots.
